intro: Phlomoides eriocalyx, commonly known as the woolly phlomoides, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and culinary uses. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, two-lipped, purple or pink flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscaping.
